snippet: The subpoenas authorized by the New Jersey legislative committee investigating the George Washington Bridge controversy include records of state police helicopters during the four days of the closings in September.
abstract: New Jersey legislative committee investigating controversial lane closings at George Washington Bridge authorizes 18 new subpoenas, including one seeking records that will show who was aboard state police helicopters during days of the lane closings in September; also votes that claims against self-incrimination by two former aides to Gov Chris Christie are insufficient and that they must turn over related documents.

byline.original: By KATE ZERNIKE and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM
byline.contributor: Kate Zernike reported from Trenton, and William K. Rashbaum from New York. Nate Schweber contributed reporting from Trenton.

lead_paragraph: The subpoenas authorized by the New Jersey legislative committee investigating the George Washington Bridge controversy include records of state police helicopters during the four days of the closings in September.

headline.main: 18 New Subpoenas Authorized in Lane Closing Inquiry
headline.print_headline: New Subpoenas Issued in Bridge Inquiry, Including Request for Helicopter Records

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
